conversations.english: Something wrong?
conversations.chinese: 有什么问题吗？
conversations.reply_english: Yes. My car is having problems.
conversations.reply_chinese: 是的。我的汽车出了点毛病。

conversations.english: Are you ready for your first driving lesson?
conversations.chinese: 准备好上第一节驾驶课了吗?
conversations.reply_english: Yes. Which one is the brake again?
conversations.reply_chinese: 准备好了.再告诉我一遍哪个是刹车?

title: 我想要租一辆音响好的车子

conversations.english: I think you made the right choice, coming to us.We have a wide selection of vehicles you can choose from.
conversations.chinese: 你来这里真是找对人了。我们这里有很多车供你选择。
conversations.reply_english: I would like to rent a car with a good stereo.
conversations.reply_chinese: 我想要租一辆音响好的车子。

title: 我准备好上驾驶课程了

conversations.english: Ok! I’m ready for my driving lesson! Should I start the car?
conversations.chinese: 我准备好上驾驶课程了。我应该先发动汽车吗？
conversations.reply_english: Hold on there，Fittipaldi, first let’s go over things one more time. Now before you even think of starting the car, make sure your seat is at a comfortable position and you can grip the steering wheel firmly. Next check your rear view mirrors to make sure you can see properly.
conversations.reply_chinese: Fittipaldi，先等下，我们再检查下。在你想发动车子前，要确保驾驶座位调到舒适的位置，且你能够紧握方向盘。下一步检查后视镜确保你能够看清。

conversations.english: Take a seat inside and see what you think.So you will take the Porsche then, sir?
conversations.chinese: 坐进去看看感觉如何。那么你要租这辆保时捷啰？
conversations.reply_english: Yes, and I want to buy the insurance too. I think it's necessary.
conversations.reply_chinese: 是的，并且我要买保险，这是需要的。

title: 路上堵车Got stuck on traffic

conversations.english: You're finally here! What took so long?
conversations.chinese: 你可算到了!怎么花了这么长的时间?
conversations.reply_english: I got stuck in traffic again. There was a terrible traffic jam near the Carrefour intersection.
conversations.reply_chinese: 又遇到堵车了.家乐福那个路口老是特别堵

conversations.english: I have a cell phone in my car. Now it's probably on the floor on the passenger side.Why don't you get it for me, and then I can call the police?
conversations.chinese: 我的车上有手提电话，现在可能掉到人行道上了。你帮我拿来，我来打电话报警。
conversations.reply_english: Alright.
conversations.reply_chinese: 好。

conversations.english: What are we going to do? I can't get the car out of this ditch. I'm stuck!
conversations.chinese: 该怎么办？车子无法离开这个沟渠，我被困住了。
conversations.reply_english: I'm worried, Tom. I haven't seen any other cars for almost an hour.
conversations.reply_chinese: 我好担心，我已经快一小时没看到其他车子了。

conversations.english: Car trouble center. How may I help you?
conversations.chinese: 汽车修理中心，你需要什么帮助？
conversations.reply_english: My car won’t start! Stupid old car!
conversations.reply_chinese: 我的车启动不了。真是破车。

conversations.english: Why don't you watch where you're going?
conversations.chinese: 你干嘛不看路？
conversations.reply_english: Me? You're the one who pulled out in front of me!
conversations.reply_chinese: 我？是你停在我前面的。

conversations.english: Is it Fred's fault?
conversations.chinese: 是弗雷德的错吗？
conversations.reply_english: No,I don't suppose he's to blame.The man in the other car made a mistake.
conversations.reply_chinese: 不，我觉得不应该怪他，另一辆车的人失误了。

conversations.english: Welcome to Al’s Garage. What seems to be the problem?
conversations.chinese: 欢迎来到Al’s汽车修理厂。有什么问题？
conversations.reply_english: No problem at all! I am taking a long road trip and I want to make sure my car is in good mechanical condition.
conversations.reply_chinese: 没问题。我正在开车行驶很远的路程，我想确保车子状况良好。

conversations.english: Jim! What’s up，man？
conversations.chinese: 吉姆，怎么了，伙计？
conversations.reply_english: Charlie! Is that your ride? It’s butt ugly, dude!
conversations.reply_chinese: Charlie，那是你的车吗？它可真丑。

conversations.english: I'm concerned about your car.
conversations.chinese: 我很担心你的汽车。
conversations.reply_english: It will be fine.
conversations.reply_chinese: 它会没事的。

conversations.english: Look out! A small boy is rushing out blindly.
conversations.chinese: 注意！一个小孩乱跑出来了。
conversations.reply_english: Gee, how dangerous! I've almost knocked him down.
conversations.reply_chinese: 哎呀，好险啊！我差一点撞倒他。

conversations.english: The road ahead is blocked. There might have been an accident.
conversations.chinese: 前面的路被堵住了。也许出了事故。
conversations.reply_english: Are there many accidents in the city every day?
conversations.reply_chinese: 城里每天有很多交通事故吗？

conversations.english: You should save some money on parking here.
conversations.chinese: 把车停在这儿可以省些钱。
conversations.reply_english: Yeah, I don’t have to pay for a space on the street.
conversations.reply_chinese: 是呀，我不用再付钱在街上找地方停车了。

conversations.english: Should I go now?
conversations.chinese: 我现在可以了吗？
conversations.reply_english: Nice and easy. Just give it a little gas.
conversations.reply_chinese: 放松点慢慢来。只要加一点点油门。

conversations.english: I'm a little nervous.
conversations.chinese: 我有点紧张。
conversations.reply_english: Don't worry. You'll be fine. First of all, put on your seat belt. Adjust the mirrors.
conversations.reply_chinese: 别担心。没事的。先系上安全带。调整后照镜。

conversations.english: Excuse me, sir. Didn't you see the red light?
conversations.chinese: 对不起，先生，你没看到红灯吗？
conversations.reply_english: Oh, I thought I could make a right turn on red here.
conversations.reply_chinese: 噢，我以为这里红灯时可以向右转。

conversations.english: I'm very sorry, sir. My car has broken down.
conversations.chinese: 非常抱歉，先生。我的车坏了。
conversations.reply_english: Sorry to hear that. Can we do anything about it?
conversations.reply_chinese: 真遗憾。还有办法吗？

conversations.english: This is exciting! Thank you so much!
conversations.chinese: 这真刺激！多谢了！
conversations.reply_english: My pleasure. Release the parking brake, and we're almost ready to go.
conversations.reply_chinese: 我的荣幸。把手煞放开，我们可以准备出发了。

conversations.english: I wish I knew how to drive.
conversations.chinese: 真希望我会开车。
conversations.reply_english: You do? No problem. I'll teach you. We can start tonight!
conversations.reply_chinese: 真的？没问题。我来教你。我们今晚就可以开始！

conversations.english: How long do you plan on staying?
conversations.chinese: 您打算停多久呢？
conversations.reply_english: I don't know! Can I park my car now?
conversations.reply_chinese: 不知道！我现在可以停车了吗？

title: 我不相信那些汽车维修店

conversations.english: I think it is easier to buy a car than to maintain it. What’s worse, I just don’t trust those vehicle maintenance shops. Sometimes, they overcharge or don’t build those parts I have been paying for. Last week, they even tried to persuade me to buy new parts which really need not to be changed. You know, my car is just half a year old and also good brand. I was just wondering about all these.
conversations.chinese: 我认为买车容易保养车难。更糟糕的是，我不相信那些汽车维修店。有时，他们收费过高或者要不给我修我一直在给钱的那些零部件。上周，他们甚至试着说服我买根本不需要换的新零部件。你知道的，我的车才买了半年，还是名牌。我对所有这些都很怀疑
conversations.reply_english: There are such shops living on selling parts. I don’t like their service either. All they want is your money. But in the long run, they will be losing costumers. Anyway, car service business is new in China. We all have to control what they are doing. Otherwise, they will not improve.
conversations.reply_chinese: 有这样一些店以卖零部件为生。我也不喜欢他们的服务。他们要的是你的钱。但是从长远来说，他们会失去客户。无论如何，汽车服务业在中国还是新行业。我们都必须控制我们的行为。否则，他们不会改进的。

conversations.english: Sir, may I please see your license and registration? Do you know how fast you were going?
conversations.chinese: 先生，我可以看看你的驾照和登记证吗？你知道你开得有多快吗？
conversations.reply_english: No, I’m not sure. I think about 65 mph, right?
conversations.reply_chinese: 不，我不知道。我想时速大约是65英里，对吗？
